column10: University of Madrid and the University of Lleida.

column2: Purpose:
column9: GIS toolkit to model ecological niche factor analysis (ENFA) and habitat suitability for animals or plants
column10: Quantify importance of habitat areas for landscape connectivity
column11: Extracts a user-defined region from a set of VEGETATION files in their distribution form (HDF format, zipped).
column12: Field data collection. Create field surveys, databases
column13: Ecological niche modeling for animals or plants
column15: Uses online geospatial data and creates distribution maps, and enables analysis
column20: Spatial Priority Ranking for Conservation and Land-Use Planning
column22: Together with its library routines it serves as a tool for data analysis and visualization in such disciplines as astronomy, geosciences and medical imaging.
column23: Locate coordinates of locations across the globe using web data services
column24: Multispectral satellite imagery. Radiomatric correction, topographic correction
column26: Package for scientific computing with Python
column27: Spatial database extender for PostgreSQL object-relational database
column28: Performs cartographic transformations and geodetic computations.
column31: Depends on sp, reads and writes rasters with spatial references to and from sp classes.
column32: Python package for manipulation and analysis of planar geometric objects (shape files)

column2: Num. Developers:
column14: 1 main developer, dozens of contributors over the years http://www.umass.edu/landeco/people/people.html

SOFTWARE ENGINEERING QUALITIES
Installability
Install the software on the virtual machine, record all steps and answers the following questions:
Are there installation instructions?
column3: For OSX use Winebottler (10 steps & not a good way to support OS X)
column10: No, just download this zip and here are the contents. EMAIL US for the command line version
column14: Yes, in a paragraph, not steps
column19: Not a direct link to binaries. Must go through ftp tree & choose which one to d/l

column2: Are the installation instructions linear? (Vnode was not linear.)
column6: No, depends on GDAL framework on MAC OS X to be installed first
column14: Yes, but steps should be in a numbered list
column31: Yes, but source installation requires a lot of dependencies
column32: No. Need to install libgeos first, and no instructions to do so

column2: Is there something in place to automate the installation (makefile, script, installer, etc.)?
column4: Yes, Makefile for source. Installers, Packages etc.
column7: Yes, shell script & binary packages (from other sources)
column28: Yes, setup.py file and exe on windows

column2: Is there a means given to validate the installation, such as a standard suite of test cases?
column26: Yes, you can run tests. Specified you can do so after installing.

column26: No uninstall available. Many directories creates
